remarks.para: One may be inoperative deactivated provided:

numlitem.para: Associated HPSOV is secured closed,
Associated Bleed switch remains OFF for takeoff,
A minimum of 70% N1 (60% N1 for RR) is maintained at or above 10,000 ft. MSL, or 55% N1 is maintained below 10,000 ft. MSL on the associated engine while in icing conditions,
Bleed systems on remaining engines are operative, and
For GE, associated engine reverser is deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: When nacelle Anti-Ice is on, maintain a minimum of 70% N1 above 10,000 MSL and 55% below 10,000 MSL.
With the HPSOV secured closed, it is normal for the Pressure Regulating and Shutoff Valve (PRSOV) to close during engine operation at idle or if engine power setting are unequal.

The associated engine’s thrust reverser is deactivated. The REV amber indication and EICAS message ENG_REVERSER may be displayed for the engine with reverser deactivated. Use symmetrical reverser thrust as required.

Thrust Reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affect engine will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverser thrust operation.
The associated Bleed Switch should be selected OFF for takeoff and may be selected ON after flaps are UP.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG____HPSOV INOP CLOSED and ____ENG BLEED OVERPRESS SW INOP and ____TR INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
Deactivate the associated Bleed switch. This will prevent the BLEED_ advisory message and the BLEED OVPRESS_ status message from displaying due to activation from the Bleed switch.

numlitem.para: Extend the leading edge flaps (AMM 27-81-00/201).

Gain access to the associated engine bleed air overpressure switch (through access panel located on wing leading edge inboard of the engine strut) and disconnect the electrical connector from the switch.

note.para: The shorting wire in the following steps is UPS tool 747-36-002-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 3 to 4 inch shorting wire from 20 to 24 SWG type 6A wire (BMS 13-60 Type 1 or BMS 13-48 Type 10) and two 20 gauge pins (P/N BACC47CN1A).
Connect sockets 2 and 5 with the fabricated shorting wire and stow the connector securely using a bundle strap.
Secure the HPSOV CLOSED using the following procedures:

note.para: The HPSOV is located on the right side of the high pressure compressor (HPC) case. To deactivate the HPSOV, it is necessary to remove the positioning screw in the valve actuator to release actuator pressure. The positioning screw is then installed in the switch actuating lever to lock the valve in the CLOSED position. It is necessary to open the right thrust reverser half to gain access to the HPSOV.

numlitem.para: Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove the positioning screw from the actuator cap. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from the positioning screw.
Install the positioning screw in the switch actuating lever to lock the HPSOV in the CLOSED position.
Close the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Secure the Thrust Reverser
Refer to MEL 78-31-1-1. Accomplish Maintenance (M) procedure to deactivate the reverser in the forward thrust position.
